Train a new petrography detection model

Source: R/training.R
train_model.Rd

Train a new petrography detection model

Usage

train_model(
  data_dir,
  output_name,
  num_classes,
  max_iter = 2000,
  learning_rate = 0.00025,
  device = "cuda",
  eval_period = 100,
  checkpoint_period = 0,
  hpc_host = Sys.getenv("PETROGRAPHER_HPC_HOST", ""),
  hpc_user = NULL,
  hpc_base_dir = Sys.getenv("PETROGRAPHER_HPC_BASE_DIR", ""),
  local_output_dir = "Detectron2_Models",
  rsync_mode = c("update", "mirror")
)

Arguments

data_dir

Local directory containing train and val subdirectories with COCO annotations

output_name

Name for the trained model (required)

num_classes

Number of object classes (required)

max_iter

Maximum training iterations (default: 2000)

learning_rate

Learning rate for training (default: 0.00025)

device

Device for local training: 'cpu', 'cuda', 'mps' (default: 'cuda')

eval_period

Validation evaluation frequency in iterations (default: 100)

checkpoint_period

Checkpoint saving frequency (0=final only, >0=every N iterations, default: 0)

hpc_host

SSH hostname for HPC training (default: PETROGRAPHER_HPC_HOST env var, or "" for local training)

hpc_user

Username for HPC (default: NULL)

hpc_base_dir

Remote base directory on HPC (default: PETROGRAPHER_HPC_BASE_DIR env var)

local_output_dir

Local directory to save trained model (default: "Detectron2_Models")

rsync_mode

Data sync mode: 'update' (default) or 'mirror' (adds –delete)

Value

Path to trained model directory
